website_summaries.verdict: Sturdy option for more experienced chicken owners who don't mind a little elbow grease.
pros: Fits up to four smaller chickens
Removable bottom tray for easy cleaning
Lightweight and quick to put together
Doors lock to keep out predators
cons: Must weatherproof the wood with stain or outdoor paint
Some owners added a base and replaced screens

customer_reviews.title: like a chain with a lock on the nesting box ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you really can't beat it! I added some extra security features, like a chain with a lock on the nesting box that easily allows me to clip the box open while collecting the eggs (we don't have that piece of wood that props it up in the photo... not sure if that is just one of the roosting bars?). Anywho... we also added chicken wire all along the bottom of the run. We added a window flower box and weather proof white paint as well.
customer_reviews.author: Clare Gephart

customer_reviews.title: Good solid product
customer_reviews.text: Although I've seen many negative reviews on this product I found the coop to be of excellent quality. The trick is to make sure the coop is treated with a good outdoor paint or stain. I also raised mine off the ground 4" by adding a base to it and added some roofing shingles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to build, quality is good for price
customer_reviews.text: super happy with this coop. We are beginners and will have two chickens. My husband and 15 year old son put the coop together in about an hour. My husband will be applying an water seal and made a base from 2x4 and wire cloth as was recommended in other reviews. I know this coop may not last several years, but for the price if we get 2-3 years it will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: It has been perfect for our three Golden Comets
customer_reviews.text: We have had this coop for about 4 months now. It has worked well but needed some modifying. We added a 2x4 frame to the bottom and then stapled wire to the bottom of the frame. This brought it off the ground a little and gave some more room for mulch. We also added some wood beams in the roof to hang our feeder and water. The wood is really soft so staining the coop is a must. It has been perfect for our three Golden Comets. I think it would be a tight for more than three chickens.
customer_reviews.author: AMJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this after reading mixed reviews. It is was pretty easy to put together, nothing damaged and I was not missing any pieces. Even had extra screws. It is a nice looking piece and sturdy enough for my needs. I would suggest a clear weather seal for longevity. I'm using this for two hens.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chicken coop the end of December and it was put together in January. My chickens have used it for 4 months and it has fallen apart. When I called Best Choice Products to address my concerns they basically said I had a 60 day warranty with them and a 90 day warranty with Amazon and while they were sorry I was beyond both warranties and basically out of luck. I spent $195.00 dollars with prior reviews being in the low 4's. Cheaply made and not able to with stand 3 chickens and 1 rooster. I WOULD not recommend purchase of this chicken coop.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne H. Steenrod

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 Chickens
customer_reviews.text: Great for two chickens. I honestly wouldn't house more than 2 as I personally do not think it is enough room (Unless you let out to free range during the day, then you could house up to 3 or 4 depending on size.) Really easy to put together. Durable though probably wouldn't hold up against really rough wear and tear. Doors and locks work perfect. Love that you can open and close the in/out door with the handle on the outside. Nesting box is easily accessible and fits two chickens perfectly. Roosting bars could of been a bit higher but something you can change on your own. Great little backyard coop!
customer_reviews.author: TAB

customer_reviews.title: Too small for the price
customer_reviews.text: This coop is very small. Can only hold 2 hens. If I would have known then what I know now after some research I would have just bought the materials and built a bigger one for cheaper. And then you have to paint, add better locks, reinforce...
customer_reviews.author: KellyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Really quite nice
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 45 minutes to put together on my own. The instructions were a littttttle vague at times but just don't put anything on backwards. The chickens began nesting in it almost immediately. I have 4 large hens. I don't keep them all inside they are a little more free range than that. But they nest in it, and roost on top of it. Super super great for how we use it. I would not feel comfortable leaving all my hens inside it for extended periods of time tho. Theres not enough room for a feeder or hydrator plus multiple hens. Not a thing, don't do that.
customer_reviews.author: kbellam

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for about $150. I think it's great. No missing parts. Instructions pretty simple. Mainly just pictures. My 11 year old I put it together in an hour or 2. I added a screen to the attic vent window from the inside with a staple gun. Also screwed 1x4's to the under side so the wood rots before the coup does and can be changed out. The wood is soft as mentioned. We have painted it 2 coats and I will put a heavy clear coat on soon. Will also add wheels on one side to roll it around.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy Construction
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with dented metal, scuffed wood, broken wood, and some of the wire wasn't attached. It is a shoddy construction job at best. I'm going to have to spend a lot of money weather proofing it and fixing the broken parts.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Y.

customer_reviews.title: not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for my 3 pullets as they grow. Very easy instructions to assemble. I did paint it two coats prior to assembly as most suggested. That caused some sticking in the sliding doors. Because of this the handles did not last a week. We will fix this by using bolts through the wood. A small modification. The screws the hardware came with are simple too small to last long. The wood handle on the vent came off with one use. It is only stapled on. Again, put a bolt thru BEFORE assembly.
customer_reviews.author: cnalley4

customer_reviews.title: A bit small but ok
customer_reviews.text: This chicken coop was decent for our 3 buff Orpingtons we have in our backyard. The sliding floor in the sleeping area was great and the overall size was nice. The nesting boxes are good but they have gaps at the bottom that makes our pine shavings fall out, we just put some cardboard underneath. The size of the sleeping area is where problems arouse, the perches where way too close to each other and too low. Also, it didn’t really specify how many chickens you could fit in there so our buffs were pretty crowded, I wouldn’t recommend more than 3 or 4 chickens to be honest. Overall it’s a decent coop that’s pretty affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Ni

customer_reviews.title: save your money for lumber you'll be better
customer_reviews.text: Missing screws, 3 rails split,roof caps falling apart,holes not drilled due to knots but board with knots left on,nesting box would not close all the way(yes it was put on correct)had to put eye and hook on in order to make it close all the way, latch busted under simple operation,save your money for lumber you'll be better off
customer_reviews.author: Dan morrison

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than it looks but decent
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give this 3 stars but it’s not real expensive and the parts fit decent even if they’re pretty light weight. I don’t think I’d keep more than like 3 chickens as there really isn’t much room for them. It was pretty easy to assemble, if you can do legos you can figure this out. I used a cordless impact driver but it could be done with a screwdriver and most holes were pre drilled so the wood wouldn’t split. The coop door with metal closer rod is a really nice touch. I don’t think I’d use it in really cold areas as it’s really thin wood.
customer_reviews.author: SteveC

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble took me about an hour by myself. Didn’t look or feel weatherproof so we weatherproofed it ourselves. The runs a bit small so we built a small extension but they like it (we have 3 grown silkies and two adolescent bantam mixes). It is VERY light so expect to have to anchor it to the ground or somehow weigh it down UPDATE. Holds up to the wind better than I thought. After a lot of rain in its lifespan (it’s now may2020) wood which we treated starting to get a little flimsy but still holding together. Definitely get stronger screws than what it came with they won’t last long but otherwise still decent
customer_reviews.author: Will Brettin

customer_reviews.title: Best choice coops!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my two chickens and was surprised of the quality. Will it last a lifetime? Probably not. But the quality and construction of it is good. It went together very easy and the chickens love it. I recently purchased a second one and attached them to each other for a larger coop for my four chickens now. There is plenty of room for them and I was able to rig up my feeding and watering system with little to no issue— just a little cutting and customizing of the chicken wire. I also put roofing shingles on top for better protection from the weather and for better longevity.
customer_reviews.author: DC 🐧

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Even while putting it together this coop broke. Some of the predrilled screw holes did not line up. The wood split in places while putting it together. We have had it since April and the door over the nesting box has already wrapped and one of the metal latches broke.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee

customer_reviews.title: Very small.
customer_reviews.text: This is quite small in size. We have 1 bantam which is okay for her but I wouldn't put anymore in there with her because of the lack of space. Mine came defective but the seller gave me a small refund. I wish it had 2 doors that opened in the main room, it would be much easier to clean out.
customer_reviews.author: Refined Finds!

customer_reviews.title: Small, not very sturdy without amendments
customer_reviews.text: Very small. 2 full sized chickens max in this, not very sturdy, a dog could tip over easily, not predator proof. Could be used as a brooder for new chicks inside a garage maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: but I am glad that I did
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this hutch because of mixed reviews, but I am glad that I did. It’s what I was looking for! Shipping was phenomenal; it shipped in two boxes, tracking numbers were included and it was delivered within three days of ordering. It was shipped via FedEx and the two boxes arrived a day apart. It was not difficult to put together, and took about 40 minutes to complete. It is pretty light weight which is nice for moving it around. I plan on making some slight modifications; painting or staining/sealing (have not decided yet) and adding a security latch to the nesting box, as well as staking it down. I highly recommend this hutch!!
customer_reviews.author: meepmeep12

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than you think
customer_reviews.text: Way smaller than you think it is. Run is too small for our three average-sized hens. It's difficult to build alone, but with two people it's pretty easy. It incredibly light. It twists if not on perfectly level ground which causes doors to bind. Set on concrete and attached 2x4's around base to add weight, strength, and anchor points. Despite it's flaws, we'll probably buy another, so we can put them end-to-end so the hens have more room.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Use Wood Glue in addition to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. Use Wood Glue in addition to the hardware. I also stained it using Thompson water seal which works well when the chickens poop on it. I added treated 2x4 on the bottom so that the coop doesn't actually touch the ground. The only thing I would change in the design is there needs a mesh netting on the vent on the front. I just stapled some to the inside before assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need work
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made coop for the most part. For the price it could have better hard ware. The nest box lid isn't secured at all, predators could easily get into it. The bottom of the nest box was slated. Another way for predators to chew their way in. Plus all the bedding falls through. So the chickens would be laying their eggs on a hard bare floor, which could break the eggs as they are laid. We had to replace the floor and hard ware. It is not big enough for 4 chickens. 3 at best.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: decent, but shabby
customer_reviews.text: The product does its job, but it could be sturdier. The hinges slip out of place constantly, they tray does not come out or go in easily at all. The sliding door came unattached. We attempted to rig it, but didnt work. We have to crawl into cage and open and close door manually. One good thing about the company is that they care. When we got the coop, there was some minor damage to it, when I contacted them, they gave me a percentage of my purchase price back. Kudos for that! Just wish it was built a little bit more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: It is small and wood is thin, not for 4 full grown chickens
customer_reviews.text: The length in the description is apparently measured with the nest box included so in reality it looks much smaller than expected. I think this would be too small for 4 full grown chickens. 2 would be ok, or 3 of a small breed. Wood is quite thin and some assembly instructions didn't match up (though is was pretty fast to assemble it). Not sure if this is predator proof. This coop is ok for young chickens and we use it for that now.
customer_reviews.author: Jorrit

customer_reviews.title: Please don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This can't be a real chicken coop. Please don't waste your money! It's not big enough inside the coop to house no more than 2 chickens. The space is super small. I ended up putting my baby chicks in it but this will not be used for adult hens.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: There was mold all over it... some pieces were broken. Directions weren’t too helpful, we had to go off other pictures from reviews to put it together. But I guess that’s what we get for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lona Leisure

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend this coop!!
customer_reviews.text: This coop is adorable and even better than expected. I made a few modifications after it was all said and done. We added a few more latches for extra security (on the nesting box and the coop door) and sealed all of the seams in the roof to ensure it was water tight, nothing major though. The construction was a breeze, took my husband and I about 30-45 minutes to complete and it comes with extra screws which is nice. We currently are housing our two hens and it is a perfect size or them, I wouldn't recommend any more than 2-3 in this coop, could get crowded. Would highly recommend this coop!!
customer_reviews.author: A. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Not predator proof, needs to be reinforced
customer_reviews.text: I really like this coop! I haven't put my chickens in it yet but it seems like it’s enough space for them while I’m at work. There were several places where water did get in but I sealed it and it’s just fine. I reinforced it with a staple gun just in case. It’s not one that will win the test of time, but it’s great for a good while to figure out what you really want. I weather seal/stained mine.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Alright so when I ordered this coop I had already planned to build a larger pen for it. It was easy to put together. I had read some reviews so I made sure to apply a water seal. I like the coop it's really cute but, the wood is really thin and when I went to screw it the wood did splinter. I think for the quality of the product it is a bit overpriced. I don't trust it in the rain so I build a roof to protect it. I also did not use all the pen just pieces of it. It came out beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Works for now. We’ll see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for 2 chickens. I wouldn’t put more than 3 chickens in here. Too small for more. The wood it’s made of is quite soft and on a lot of pieces the wood was splintered and peeling off. I decided to caulk between pieces to keep water from soaking into crevices, and I also painted it. Very happy with it. I will say the hardware (locks especially) could be better. Also no lock on the nesting box. Will have to add one.
customer_reviews.author: W S

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. Very Cute. A little small.
customer_reviews.text: This coop is really cute and tiny. I wouldn't expect a giant coop for $200, but this thing really is tiny. MAX 2 chickens. Sure its the TAJ compared to what they get at Tyson, but still pretty small. Easy to assemble in 30 minutes with a drill. I sealed the whole thing just to be on the safe side. It rains/snows all the time where I'm at so I'm not chancing it. Pretty sure my chickens will die in the winter unless I come up with some sort of winterization/insulation?
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I love this for our chickens, we did add an extended run on it, and they free range a lot during the day, but I love the ease of this coop. I can easily access everything I need to clean with little problem. We put a clear seal coat on before we put it outside, but so far this has been working out great for us!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle DeMint

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a starter couo
customer_reviews.text: Made from soft cedar wood. Holes are predrilled, but you need to be gentle to not rip the pieces apart. The layout is okay. 3 chickens are about the most you want to use this thing for. The interior is tiny. The walls are thin too. You can easily build one like this for half the cost, but that takes time.
customer_reviews.author: Gabi

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price...
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 hens who free-range during the day- they stay in this coop at night and lay eggs in nest box in early morning. I would never use this coop as 24/7 housing. It is too small. We live in dry area- not much rain. The coop is still in great shape after 1 year. If you handle it well, it will last. I did apply weather seal, and added a latch to the nest box.
customer_reviews.author: Alamo Sam

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment:(
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this is made of cheap wood. This would not keep predators out waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Product came in two separate boxes, wrapped in paper & styrofoam. I had to sweep most of the items off as it looked like there were little pieces of fiberglass looking material on them. Easy to put together and a decent size, although I think it may be a bit small for 4 hens. It is a bit hard to get to the area underneath the coop without having another person to lift it up. Another door in that area would be great! Not sure about the weather proofing of it yet as it is still inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Jagow

customer_reviews.title: Good coop
customer_reviews.text: The coop can fit up to 6 or 7 chickens if you add racks. It is mainly in my case a place where my chickens sleep at night cause during the day they are outdoors. I like it in my backyard my problem is that it gets dirty very often and it is because it is not coated or painted the stains are sometimes hard to remove but other than that my chickens seem happy
customer_reviews.author: radia

customer_reviews.title: Great kit.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Great workmanship too. Used construction adhesive with all joints and replaced all latches and bolts with quality ones. Built 2x4 base for it. Stained it. It's great now, think of it like a pinewood derby build. This is a kit to start with and it's really nice from that standpoint. Amazingly light for portability. Seriously recommended if you're willing to put in the effort.
customer_reviews.author: sidetone1

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a quick fix
customer_reviews.text: Chintzy but does the job my chickens love it. the "run" part is quite small but we added more space for girls. I love that it has all the different openings too peak in on them at night without disturbing them, I wouldn't trust this if you live in a high predator environment but it's sutible for a suburban area. The tray slides out in the hutch for easy clean up with us a plus no taking it apart to hose it down.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. If you're expecting the best chicken coop for $200, you're going to be disappointed. This came packaged pretty well and arrived with not damage. My only complaint and the reason it didnt get 5 stars is because it didnt include directions. I found another user review here who took a picture of the directions (thank you!!) and was able to get it together from there. WIthout that, good luck! Took me about an hour to put together and it looks really nice and I think it will serve its purpose well. I'll definitely look at weather proofing it for the fall and winter months.
customer_reviews.author: ehoagland1

customer_reviews.title: Was pretty simple to put together by myself
customer_reviews.text: It is really cute! Was pretty simple to put together by myself. I am using it for my bunnies. The slide out flooring is perfect for cleaning. I love the lifting roof and the sliding window to peek at them. And the buns also love the ramp and the run below for laying out and chilling. The wood is very thin and fragile so I am not sure if it will last longer than a couple summers but perhaps a coat of paint will make it longer lasting.
customer_reviews.author: 4f8kit

customer_reviews.title: Good start up coop
customer_reviews.text: I'm not totally sure how long its supposed to last, we got it fall September 2019 and the wood is pretty worn by rain. We live in Central North Carolina but I dont think we got so much rain it should be worn this much. Its definitely a great starter coop and got the job done for our 3 girls but now, a little less than a year later, we're in the market for a new coop. Good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Lipumano

customer_reviews.title: Not that great!
customer_reviews.text: Put together but the slide in tray is giving me a fit, when i slide in all the way it hangs in the back and no weight can be put on it or my silkies will fall through it, not safe so i will have to take them out and fix it some how.
customer_reviews.author: Ace P.

customer_reviews.title: It seems really good.
customer_reviews.text: It's very cute for an urban backyard but seems like it may not stand up over time. It has a broken latch on the gate and after reading other reviews I won't be contacting the company for a replacement. I will also be adding a cedar coating or the weather. I'm happy with it for now as I only want two chickens.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Chancellor

customer_reviews.title: Not the correct size
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not even close to being the size it says it is dont waste your money buy from a local dealer or build your own that's what I wish I had done
customer_reviews.author: david mccarter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, especially since I recently had shoulder surgery. It only has enough roosting room for three chickens but it does have two nesting boxes. I'm adding a run to it to give them more freedom but it's made it very easy to give my new chicks a safe place while my older chickens are in the old coop. It's made of cedar and we will be painting it and adding shingles on the roof to make it last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Norsworthy

customer_reviews.title: Too small for 4 chickens
customer_reviews.text: Too small.for 4 chickens. We have had it for 2 weeks and it's falling apart already. This is worth 100, at most.
customer_reviews.author: JShag

customer_reviews.title: Warping roof
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for this and for the most part it's doing its job. Assembly was easy and manageable with one person. After assembly I sealed the wood inside and out. After a few months the rooftop already has signs of warpage. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I realized that i had received only about half of the parts about midway thru assembling the coup. I contacted best choice products "what a joke" and was told i needed to disassemble the coup and return for a replacement. I explained that o didn't need a replacement I only need the missing parts but was told my only option was to return the coup. Horrible customer service! I will not purchase from Best choice products again.
customer_reviews.author: Clay A.

customer_reviews.title: actual size
customer_reviews.text: I liked the easy assembly, I did not like the size of it, it’s deceiving . I only have to Ashrock chickens and they barely fit. Way too small for chickens! really disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: enoc

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I just wish it was 100% waterproof. Other than that, it was way easier to set up than I originally thought. Make sure to measure when you being building the nesting box to ensure it's even. I have 1 regular sized Delaware and 3 Batman chickens and they hang out in the coop pretty comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Super great

customer_reviews.title: Chicken Coop Review
customer_reviews.text: It was fairly easy to put together with a 2nd person to stabilize the parts. It isn't very easy to clean. The tray, possibly due to my putting it together, doesn't slide out easily. The divider between two areas of the nesting box doesn't stay in it's spot. It would be nice if there were 2 doors to open on the side of the coop for cleaning the top area of the coop easier.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Sohlden

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Enclosure
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful for the price. Instructions are a little vague, but the product is wonderful. Would suggest having a helping hand to set it up. Works perfect for what I needed it for. Great little enclosure.
customer_reviews.author: HuntressExtreme

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was good to begin with but only after 4 months the ...
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was good to begin with but only after 4 months the wood is warping, screws coming loose, ramp broke off and it leaks :(. Plus it is much smaller than it seems.
customer_reviews.author: natalie

customer_reviews.title: Great little coop! I need another!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! It’s a little smaller than I thought, but it will work for now, I was going to buy another, but it is out of stock! (I hope they get more in!) My chicks are only a few weeks old, so I’m just using for day field trips to the yard!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fragile and low quality.  Not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.text: The coop is quite fragile and the instruction to assemble it ar quite poor but if you are handy it should not be a problem. We had to paint inside and outside otherwise it won’t last more than a year at most. I would not use it for more than 2 hens as the space is quite small. For now it work OK
customer_reviews.author: cbduser

customer_reviews.title: Egg box is essentially open on bottom to invaders.
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy. You would have to spend a lot more for something bigger and sturdier. Good for a couple of backyard chickens that can free range.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Very small coop
customer_reviews.text: It works for newly hatched chicks up to 6 weeks old but definitely not for 4, 8 weeks old chickens. The run is very small. Maybe 1 or 2 chickens but not more than that. Quality is meh.. not strong at all. It is cheap material, does that have any meat to it for longterm use. To waterproof it I painted with exterior paint.
customer_reviews.author: Shah73

customer_reviews.title: after 1 year, a big hole in the aluminum tray!
customer_reviews.text: We liked this coop for our little flock of 3 chickens, but exactly 1 year into use, the metal tray/bottom has corroded through, and has a big gaping hole in it! I have cleaned out the coop every week, rinsed the tray, and kept pine shavings in it. So. This seems like an epic design fail, only 1 year into use. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a Pet Rabbit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a home for my rabbit. This thing got an entire overhaul. Putting it together took much more work than expected.Directions are vague and then I changed out the inside layout and added flooring and a window. I’m really happy with the final result and so is my rabbit. As others have said - it has good bones but needs work.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS P.O.S. The metal in the roosting area rusts all the way through losing SERIOUS risks for chickens. They can injure their legs on the jagged, rusted edges and worse, they can ingest the metal and become fatally ill!!!! What kind of idiot designs a coop so poorly that it can literally cause life-threatening injuries to the animal it’s made to house?? AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Nice Coop
customer_reviews.text: I’ll update this review later once I’ve had time to have the chickens in it for a bit. Ordered on Tuesday and it was to be delivered Friday. It came a day early, which was a welcome surprise. Two of us put it together in a little over an hour. It went together easily and shored itself up well. We even read part of the instructions. I’ve put a water proof coating on the exterior (only) to add to the life span. So far it’s great. Might be a bit small when my three chicks are fully grown. While the wood is thinner than what I would buy, it’s a lot better than many of the reviews give it credit.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Decent for a small hobbyist or beginner
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Definitely needs more weight attached around the bottom perimeter, as other reviewers have stated. We built it, stained/ waterproofed with Thompsons and it is perfect. It needs better latches and predator proofing underneath coop and nesting boxes but all and all it's great for the money. This was my 9 yr old sons Christmas gift and it is great to know we built it, sealed it and can continue to modify it together before the spring. We are used to having 22+ chickens, so this is a change. It will likely hold 3, MAYBE 4 bantams. Good purchase. I'd recommend it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is build cheap in my opinion, and will not last beyond six months
customer_reviews.text: I think saying it will hold 4 hens would be a wrong. Maybe 2 at the most. It is cheap made, and I would guess not last long. I have yet to use mine, I have it put up, but now waiting for a cage to enclose it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Deluxe coop
customer_reviews.text: We received our coop and decided to give it added weather protection by adding a couple coats of primer and paint. Added a couple hooks (no latch included on the egg box) and a wired bottom attached to a couple 2x4's for extra security against any possible predators. Now we just need the chickens!
customer_reviews.author: teasy

customer_reviews.title: Don't construct this with your significant other...
customer_reviews.text: Alot of parts that weren't pre milled. Made the coop crooked, frustrated me and made me want to strangle my husband. Now on top of needing to reconstruct the coop I'll probably need marriage counseling and whiskey.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.Chu

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Perfect for three chickens just needed a couple extra screws to make it more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bates

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and the assembly was over all easy except for the laying box. I’ve put some wooden glue between each part as suggested by other user.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Philippe REY

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: This coop is a great size and only took a little over an hour to assemble. I am using it as a transition coop for my new chicks and it is perfect! I really am happy I made this purchase. I will add that with all of these pre-fab coops, there isn’t much security from predators so I’ll be adding additional hooks/latches that I can better secure. Thank you for the nice product!
customer_reviews.author: Ariana Swafford

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Very easy assembly and delivered quickly. Coop is on the smaller side and wood is lighter material than I expected, but it’s very visually appealing and our chicks seem very happy with their new home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small... not predator proof!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble for one person. Very easy to clean. Extremely lightweight. Not predator proof. Does NOT fit four hens. I have three Wyandottes (large hens) and this is not a good fit for them long-term. Great short-term option with modifications. Run is too small for my hens, they cannot spread their wings.
customer_reviews.author: JennB

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap material, similar to IKEA “wood”. We put an all weather stain On all pieces before we assembled. I don’t see it lasting too many seasons, but it’s a good first starter coop.
customer_reviews.author: The Addlemans

customer_reviews.title: but feel like I have to in this case
customer_reviews.text: I have never ever written an online review, but feel like I have to in this case. We were excited about this product as it had some great reviews and seemed to be what we needed for our two little chickens. It came within a week and took about 2 hours to assemble. However, the next morning, after the very first night it was out, we woke up to the horror scene of our massacred chickens. My daughter was DEVASTATED. We are new to this whole chicken thing and didn't realize the nesting box was easily accessed. Why is there no built in lock for this piece of the coop???
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice hen house
customer_reviews.text: This hen house is nice it's a bit smaller than I thought but my hen's just love it. I have added a second hen house and a run pin to it and they will not go into the other house so now I am going to have to get more hen's.lol
customer_reviews.author: Geomap

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble. Seems to be holding up well.
customer_reviews.text: It's a chicken coop so I keep chickens in it -- three very small Serama hens and a rooster. Happy with it. One part of coop is hard to reach for cleaning and recommend an expanded run if chickens are not able to run freely.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha W. Canright

customer_reviews.title: Really SMALL
customer_reviews.text: This is big enough for 1 chicken., JUST 1 chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: You will need to add security measures.
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 chickens and it fits them just fine I don’t know if I would cram anymore in it. It is sort of flimsy. You need to know that you will have to add security measures such as better and more locks and latches. It took my husband about 1 1/2 hours to put it together by himself and Then another 1 hour to secure it. I love it from an aesthetic standpoint. The lever to close the coop at night is great. You have to put chicken wire or something over the window.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Brody

customer_reviews.title: Easily falls apart with a stiff breeze
customer_reviews.text: Cheap materials. Easily falls apart with a stiff breeze. Lasted all of 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super cute but Expect to enhance
customer_reviews.text: This is a super cute coop but I received one box and have never received the second box. I have contacted the seller and they don’t seem too concerned that I only have half of it. From what I have, I think that with some adjustments it will be just fine. I have stained with a outdoor stain and will replace the wire and latches like recommended by others. I only plan to put 2-3 small silkies in it and then will add an extra fenced area for more room to roam for my fancy footed critters.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hart

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to accommodate for small chickens And they fit perfectly. It was larger than I anticipated. well made product and easy to put together. Great product and inexpensive
customer_reviews.author: erica lopez ulloa

customer_reviews.title: Well built.
customer_reviews.text: Not very big for more than three chickens. It is hard to clean cage. Back breaker for sure. I did add on to roost and a side cage for feeding and excersize.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great coop for use as a chick brooder. it’s a small coop, but the chicks are doing well in it. Can’t imagine having more than 1-2 adult hens live in there due to small size. Very light weight, so had to stake it down to anchor it. We painted the coop with deck stain to water proof it further. Used wood glue during assembly. Easy to understand building instructions and easy to assemble. I did add extra more substantial locks/latches. Not predator proof, especially with the removable floor board in the nesting box. I ended cutting and placing a wooden board as the floor for the nesting box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Other animals can get in to it pretty easy. Lost 2 chickens one night
customer_reviews.text: Very soft wood. Other animals can get in to it pretty easy. Lost 2 chickens one night. Lightweight, which is good for moving it around but not good when it gets windy. Had to tie it down. The ramp came off its nails in the first 3 days. Not a good coop if you want one to last a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This coop is nice looking but not practical. It claimed to hold 6 chickens. Not true. Also the perching sticks will not stay in place. The nursing box is hard to clean out. There is some a couple places where it is falling apart. I should have saved the money and build my own.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Harris

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying it so far!
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 chickens and was hoping to let them free roam once large enough, but I have too many critters that won’t leave them alone. So I added this extra cage for them to have plenty of roam and stay save from my fur family.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Brown

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Bottom came loose on nesting box 2 months after using. Have a 5 gal bucket wedges underneath it to keep it from falling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to raise small pullets until they were big enough to put in with the adult chickens. I had to build a 2x4 frame under it so it was sturdy enough to move without falling apart. Kind of a pain to assemble. Cute to look at , just not very functional.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Whitesell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, super cute!
customer_reviews.text: Most of the holes are pre-drilled. Assembled in about an hour. Definitely wouldn't put more than 4 birds in here. Directions could be a little more clear, but overall we love it! Will consider anchoring it into the ground because it's very light also putting a latch on the nesting box to keep Raccoons and other critters out.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: DONOT buy!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This coup is to small for two chickens. One chicken maybe!!!!!! I would not recommend it because it isn't what you read on the website and nothing like it is when you get it.... DONOT BUY IT..... NOT WORTH TH MONEY... Wish there was a way to try before buying then you can tell... This is what happens when you buy online... NOT HAPPY AT ALL.... Had to spend more money and build a bigger coup for chickens.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Product is decently made but is not strong enough (or weigh enough) to uphold strong winds (coop completely flipped over). Spacious enough for 2 hens. Ramp broke early on and it's a bit hard to clean with where it opens.
customer_reviews.author: Srb

customer_reviews.title: Great little coop!
customer_reviews.text: I have my 2 baby ducks & 2 chickens sleep in this pen. The chickens like to roost on the roof during the day. Now that the chicks have grown up I moved this ‘house’ inside an enclosed dog pen & removed the door. I do however let my pers out to free range several times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer F.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: She and her best buddy assembled this and it looks awesome
customer_reviews.text: Chicken Condo. I can't believe my daughter is actually raising chickens. She and her best buddy assembled this and it looks awesome. Very sturdy and fits two plump chickens. She did add locks on both doors and secured it to the ground with nail spikes.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This very lightweight and will blow over if not secured and the wood has mildew on it from being out in the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Christman

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT size. I don't think it would be big ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 3 chickens. PERFECT size. I don't think it would be big enough any more though. We painted it red and white to look like a barn. I am hoping it holds up good through the winter and snow. We'll see....
customer_reviews.author: Andrabart

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be a durable chicken coop. It is very lightweight, almost no finish on it, no sealer around the screws. The door locks are not sturdy. This unit is more like a doll house.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Great starter hen house!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great product. Very easy to assemble and worked wonder for 2 chickens. But 2 is cramped. So we have since upgraded as we now have more birds.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer bondi

customer_reviews.title: Size matters
customer_reviews.text: This coop was supposed to be big enough for 4 chickens. It really is not. They are tiny! I bought 2 and ended up putting them together and adding on a center space to make it bigger. The run is also very small. I would say it can accommodate maybe 2 chickens comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with product
customer_reviews.text: Overall very pleased with this product. Assembly would be a bit easier if hikes were marked or pre-drilled for start but Wood is soft and I was able to assemble this myself in about an hour. Not weatherproof but easily remedied with some sort of stain, paint, etc. Seems sturdy enough but is light weight. Wish it came with latches for nesting box to secure that area. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

product_meta.title: Best Choice Products Outdoor Wooden Chicken Coop Wire Fence Hen House Poultry Cage, 80in, Brown, for 4 Birds
product_meta.description: This chicken coop is designed to not only house chickens but can be used for keeping roosters, rabbits, ducks, or other small animals. Its solid rain-resistant fir wood provides durability to keep your animals safe from most weather conditions. The cage also includes a nesting box that has an easy-access open/close roof top to allow you to easily give your animals food and water, clean their living area, or collect eggs. The raised housing areas and caged running area will give your chickens or pets plenty of living space. For the most durable and fully equipped cage for your pets or animals, check out this wooden chicken coop by Best Choice Products! DISCLAIMER: Our chicken coops are meant to house animals, but will not guarantee their safety from potential predators. Click Here for the assembly video. SPECIFICATIONS: Overall Dimensions: 79.5”(L) x 26.5”(W) x 51.5”(H); Raised Housing Dimensions: 24.5”(L) x 23”(W) x 33”(H); Nesting Box Dimensions: 20.5”(L) x 12.5”(W) x 15.25”(H); Cage Dimensions: 62.5”(L) x 22.75”(W) x 39”(H); Ramp Dimensions: 31”(L) x 7”(W); Slide-Out Tray Dimensions: 22”(L) x 22”(W) x 1”(H); Raised Housing Door Dimensions: 10.5”(W) x 15.75”(H); Cage Door Dimensions: 16.5”(W) x 29.5”(H); Slide Window Opening Dimensions: 3.5”(L) x 5”(H); Comes in 2 boxes; Weight: 50 lbs.; Assembly required (with instructions)
feature_bullets: COMFORTABLE LIVING SPACE: Sliding door and ramp allows chickens to easily enter the comfortable, raised housing area
SECURE AND ACCESSIBLE: 2 doors include a metal locking system and open/close nesting box that allows for easy access into both cage areas
WEATHER-RESISTANT: A solid rainproof fir wood construction makes the cage durable even in unfavorable weather conditions
EASY TO CLEAN: Comes with a removable bottom sliding tray for easy cleaning and metal wire fencing for ventilation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars501 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
